skill.name: finishing-a-development-branch
skill.description: Use when implementation is complete, all tests pass, and you need to decide how to integrate the work - guides completion of development work by presenting structured options for merge, PR, or cleanup
skill.summary: Use when implementation is complete, all tests pass, and you need to decide how to integrate the wor...
skill.author: Cygnusfear

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill that provides structured guidance for completing git workflows. It contains no executable code, network requests, or file access beyond documenting standard git commands.

content.value_statement: Developers often struggle with the final steps of feature development. This skill provides a clear, structured process for completing branches with proper testing and integration options.
actual_capabilities: Guides local merge with test verification
Automates PR creation with proper formatting
limitations: Requires tests to be configured in project
Does not handle merge conflicts automatically
GitHub CLI required for PR creation option

use_cases.title: Complete Feature Development
use_cases.description: After implementing a new feature, use this skill to merge it back to main or create a pull request with proper testing.

use_cases.title: Standardize Team Workflow
use_cases.description: Ensure team members follow consistent branch completion practices with proper test verification and cleanup.

use_cases.title: Clean Up Development Worktrees
use_cases.description: Safely clean up development worktrees after feature completion while preserving important work.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Branch Completion
prompt_templates.prompt: I've finished implementing the new checkout flow. All tests are passing. Help me complete this branch using the finishing-a-development-branch skill.

prompt_templates.title: After Major Refactoring
prompt_templates.prompt: I've completed a major refactoring of the authentication system. Tests pass but I want to create a PR for code review before merging.

prompt_templates.title: Experimental Feature
prompt_templates.scenario: Deciding whether to keep experimental work
prompt_templates.prompt: I built an experimental caching layer but I'm not sure if we should merge it. Let me see my options for handling this branch.

prompt_templates.title: Clean Up Old Branches
prompt_templates.prompt: I have several old feature branches that need to be either merged or discarded. Help me clean them up systematically.

output_examples.input: I've finished the new payment integration. Tests are passing. What should I do next?
output: Implementation complete. What would you like to do?
2. Push and create a Pull Request
3. Keep the branch as-is (I'll handle it later)

best_practices: Always verify tests pass before offering completion options
Present exactly 4 structured options without additional explanation
Require typed 'discard' confirmation before deleting work permanently
anti_patterns: Never proceed with failing tests - this prevents broken code integration
Don't ask open-ended questions like 'What should I do?' - provide structured choices
Avoid automatic worktree cleanup for PR creation - preserve worktree for potential updates

faq.question: Which git workflows does this support?
faq.answer: Supports standard git workflows with main/master branches. Works with or without GitHub CLI for PR creation.

faq.question: What happens to my worktree after completion?
faq.answer: Worktree is cleaned up for local merges and discards, but preserved when creating PRs or keeping branches.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my CI/CD pipeline?
faq.answer: The skill verifies tests pass before proceeding, integrating with your existing test suite regardless of CI/CD setup.

faq.question: Is my code safe during this process?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill requires confirmation before discarding work and always verifies tests before merging.

faq.question: What if I encounter merge conflicts?
faq.answer: The skill stops before merging if conflicts exist. Resolve conflicts manually, then re-run the skill.

faq.question: How does this compare to git-flow?
faq.answer: This skill complements git-flow by providing a structured completion process for any branch, not just feature branches.
